articles.author: BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: BEIRUT, Lebanon (AP) — An Israeli airstrike on a Beirut apartment block killed a senior Hezbollah leader and about a dozen other members of the militant group, Israel's military said Saturday as Lebanon raised the attack's death toll to 37, including women and children.
articles.title: Top Hezbollah leader was among the 37 people killed in an Israeli strike on a Beirut apartment block

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israeli strike on a school in northern Gaza on Saturday killed at least 22 people, according to the Gaza Health Ministry, while the Israeli army said that it targeted a Hamas command center in what used to be a school.
articles.title: An Israeli strike on a school kills at least 22 people, Gaza Health Ministry says

articles.author: MEG KINNARD and ERIK VERDUZCO
articles.description: WILMINGTON, N.C. (AP) — Donald Trump returns to North Carolina on Saturday, stumping in the southern battleground state that both Democrats and Republicans are treating as increasingly critical to victory in November.
articles.title: Donald Trump returns to North Carolina without Mark Robinson, one of his top in-state supporters

articles.author: DAN MERICA, GARANCE BURKE and ALI SWENSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — With the 2024 election looming, the first since the mass popularization of generative artificial intelligence, experts feared the worst: social media flooded with AI-generated deepfakes that were so realistic, baffled voters wouldn’t know what to believe.
articles.title: AI is helping shape the 2024 presidential race. But not in the way experts feared

articles.author: JONATHAN LANDRUM Jr.
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Sean “Diddy” Combs created a hit-making empire with big name performers, earning his place as a savvy music mogul and becoming a three-time Grammy winner while securing high-profile deals across other industries.
articles.title: Diddy faces public scrutiny over alleged sex crimes as questions arise about future of his music

articles.author: JONATHAN MATTISE and LEA SKENE
articles.description: BALTIMORE (AP) — Federal agents on Saturday boarded a vessel managed by the same company as a cargo ship that caused the deadly Baltimore bridge collapse, the FBI confirmed.
articles.title: FBI agents have boarded vessel managed by company whose other cargo ship collapsed Baltimore bridge

articles.author: DAVID CRARY
articles.description: Just two years ago, leading anti-abortion activists were euphoric as the U.S. Supreme Court overturned the 1973 Roe v.
articles.title: Euphoric two years ago, US anti-abortion movement is now divided and worried as election nears

articles.author: JACK DURA
articles.description: Stuart and Tonya Junker loved their quiet neighborhood near South Dakota's Black Hills — until the earth began collapsing around them, leaving them wondering if their home could tumble into a gaping hole.
articles.title: Giant sinkholes in a South Dakota neighborhood make families fear for their safety

articles.author: STEPHEN WADE
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — If you're trying to lose weight and want a new way to do it, stair-climbing as a regular exercise — or just adding a few flights a day — might be for you.It's accessible, and research shows it's more effective than walking on level ground.
articles.title: Want to burn calories? Climbing stairs might be the most effective exercise for you

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE
articles.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — Fall is back, and bringing with it jack-o'-lanterns, football, pumpkin spice everything and — in some parts of the country — especially vibrant foliage.
articles.title: The Midwest could offer fall’s most electric foliage but leaf peepers elsewhere won’t miss out
